definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering/hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity
diligent and able to endure hardship (idiom)

sentences.english: Can Bear hardships and hard work, healthly and strong, could adapt aloft operation outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 喫苦耐勞，身體健碩，適應戶外高空操作設備。

sentences.english: They stressed that we must destroy the spirit of hard work.
sentences.chinese: 一定要毀掉他們強調過的刻苦耐勞精神。

sentences.english: Good communication, work hard and endure hardships, long-term work at.
sentences.chinese: 善於溝通，喫苦耐勞，能長期在項目現場工作。

sentences.english: There is diligent spirit and team cooperation consciousness, obey an upper grade leadership.
sentences.chinese: 有食用苦耐勞的精神和團隊協作意識，服從上級領導。

sentences.english: It's sur-prising that she can bear up with such an affliction.
sentences.chinese: 她能這樣刻苦耐勞是令人喫驚的。
煤礦工人都是能喫苦耐勞的。

sentences.english: Have a strong self-learning ability and being hard working .
sentences.chinese: 有較強的自學能力和刻苦耐勞的精神。

sentences.english: "We learned to endure hardship, " she says.
Hiring constrcution people, labour working, need to be harding working, immigrant or citizen preferred.
sentences.chinese: 招聘裝修雜工，要能夠喫苦耐勞，移民或者公民。

sentences.english: Conclusions Provoking energetically the traditional cultural spirit of Hakkas should be done.
sentences.chinese: 結論應積極發揚客家傳統文化和喫苦耐勞的精神。

sentences.english: It is generally known that the overseas Chinese are a hardworking lot.
sentences.chinese: 衆所周知華僑是刻苦耐勞的。

sentences.english: Most of the soldiers were hardy young men.
sentences.chinese: 大部分士兵都是喫苦耐勞的年輕小夥。

sentences.english: Diligent, strong sense of responsibility, knowledge-craving as well as team-work spirited .
sentences.chinese: 工作努力，責任心強，喫苦耐勞，上進，組織觀念強。

sentences.english: But she was tough enough to face it.
sentences.chinese: 但她足夠喫苦耐勞來面對挑戰。
